info.title: GovStack Digital Registries BB API examples
info.description: Digital Registries System contains multiple registries in one instance. For each registry same set of APIs is described. In this example two example registries have been described.

get.description: Searches (Regex supported) and returns multiple records as an array-list.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Field for searching random string type data from database

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Field name that user wishes to filter

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: How user wishes to order the data

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results on one page

parameters.name: query.<fieldName>
parameters.description: Example of searchable database field. If more searchable fields are in DB, then more similar fields will follow in input

schema.example: Value can be in any supported format, for an example 'string'

post.description: Creates a new record in the registry database.

nationality.description: Child is a citizen of this country. ISO 3166-1 encoding list

child.description: Child object data that is queried from database

nationality.description: Child is a citizen of this country. ISO 3166-1 encoding list

child.description: Child object data that is queried from database

post.description: Searches records based on input parameters and returns boolean answer (true/false).

put.description: Updates one existing record in the registry database.

query.description: Search object that needs to be updated

write.description: Update found object with the following data

put.description: Updates multiple records in the registry database that match the input query.

query.description: Find objects that needs to be updated

write.description: Data that needs to be added to the found objects

post.description: API updates existing record if matching with input parameters is successful. If record is not found the API will create a new record.

query.description: Find object to update, if object not found, new will be created

write.description: Data that will be updated for found Example object. If object not found new object with this data is created

schema.description: ID of the citizen that needs to be deleted from the Registry data query API

get.description: Searches and returns one recordâ€™s one field value.
Allows a user to see who has read their personal data.

schema.description: Array of found data processign logs

expiryDate.description: The expiry date of the registration

url.description: URL to the birth certificate document
URL to the Caretaker's picture file
URL to the Caretaker's identification document

readerId.description: Identifier of a reader who looked at personal data
